trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager Architecture
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Architecture

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of both the Service Management and Resource Manager architectures for creating infrastructure-based applications and workloads.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of both the Service Management and Resource Manager architectures for creating infrastructure-based applications and workloads.

trans-unit.source: Architecture for Service Management
trans-unit.target: Architecture for Service Management

trans-unit.source: Before we discuss the architecture of Azure Resource Manager and the various resource providers, let's review the architecture that currently exists for Azure Service Management.
trans-unit.target: Before we discuss the architecture of Azure Resource Manager and the various resource providers, let's review the architecture that currently exists for Azure Service Management.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Service Management, the compute, storage, or network resources for hosting virtual machines are provided by:
trans-unit.target: In Azure Service Management, the compute, storage, or network resources for hosting virtual machines are provided by:

trans-unit.source: A required cloud service that acts as a container for hosting virtual machines (compute).
trans-unit.target: A required cloud service that acts as a container for hosting virtual machines (compute).

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines are automatically provided with a network interface card (NIC) and an IP address assigned by Azure.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines are automatically provided with a network interface card (NIC) and an IP address assigned by Azure.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the cloud service contains an external load balancer instance, a public IP address, and default endpoints to allow remote desktop and remote PowerShell traffic for Windows-based virtual machines and Secure Shell (SSH) traffic for Linux-based virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the cloud service contains an external load balancer instance, a public IP address, and default endpoints to allow remote desktop and remote PowerShell traffic for Windows-based virtual machines and Secure Shell (SSH) traffic for Linux-based virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: A required storage account that stores the VHDs for a virtual machine, including the operating system, temporary, and additional data disks (storage).
trans-unit.target: A required storage account that stores the VHDs for a virtual machine, including the operating system, temporary, and additional data disks (storage).

trans-unit.source: An optional virtual network that acts as an additional container, in which you can create a subnetted structure and designate the subnet on which the virtual machine is located (network).
trans-unit.target: An optional virtual network that acts as an additional container, in which you can create a subnetted structure and designate the subnet on which the virtual machine is located (network).

trans-unit.source: Architecture for Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Architecture for Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: For Azure Resource Manager, resource providers support the individual resources for creating functioning virtual machines in the configuration that you need.
trans-unit.target: For Azure Resource Manager, resource providers support the individual resources for creating functioning virtual machines in the configuration that you need.

trans-unit.source: For virtual machines, there are three main resource providers:
trans-unit.target: For virtual machines, there are three main resource providers:

trans-unit.source: Compute Resource Provider (CRP): Supports instances of virtual machines and optional availability sets.
trans-unit.target: Compute Resource Provider (CRP): Supports instances of virtual machines and optional availability sets.

trans-unit.source: Storage Resource Provider (SRP): Supports required storage accounts that store the VHDs for virtual machines, including their operating system and additional data disks.
trans-unit.target: Storage Resource Provider (SRP): Supports required storage accounts that store the VHDs for virtual machines, including their operating system and additional data disks.

trans-unit.source: Network Resource Provider (NRP): Supports required NICs, virtual machine IP addresses, and subnets within virtual networks and optional load balancers, load balancer IP addresses, and Network Security Groups.
trans-unit.target: Network Resource Provider (NRP): Supports required NICs, virtual machine IP addresses, and subnets within virtual networks and optional load balancers, load balancer IP addresses, and Network Security Groups.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, there are relationships between the resources within the resource providers:
trans-unit.target: Additionally, there are relationships between the resources within the resource providers:

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine depends on a specific storage account defined in the SRP to store its disks in blob storage (required).
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine depends on a specific storage account defined in the SRP to store its disks in blob storage (required).

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine references a specific NIC defined in the NRP (required) and an availability set defined in the CRP (optional).
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine references a specific NIC defined in the NRP (required) and an availability set defined in the CRP (optional).

trans-unit.source: A NIC references the virtual machine's assigned IP address (required), the subnet of the virtual network for the virtual machine (required), and to a Network Security Group (optional).
trans-unit.target: A NIC references the virtual machine's assigned IP address (required), the subnet of the virtual network for the virtual machine (required), and to a Network Security Group (optional).

trans-unit.source: A subnet within a virtual network references a Network Security Group (optional).
trans-unit.target: A subnet within a virtual network references a Network Security Group (optional).

trans-unit.source: A load balancer instance references the backend pool of IP addresses that include the NIC of a virtual machine (optional) and references a load balancer public or private IP address (optional).
trans-unit.target: A load balancer instance references the backend pool of IP addresses that include the NIC of a virtual machine (optional) and references a load balancer public or private IP address (optional).

trans-unit.source: The componentization of resources allows for more flexibility when configuring the infrastructure for an IT workload hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The componentization of resources allows for more flexibility when configuring the infrastructure for an IT workload hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates take advantage of this flexibility to create the set of dependent resources needed for a specific configuration.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates take advantage of this flexibility to create the set of dependent resources needed for a specific configuration.

trans-unit.source: When executing a template, Resource Manager ensures that the resources for a configuration are created in the correct order to preserve the dependencies and references.
trans-unit.target: When executing a template, Resource Manager ensures that the resources for a configuration are created in the correct order to preserve the dependencies and references.

trans-unit.source: For example, Resource Manager will not create the NIC for a virtual machine until it has created the virtual network with a subnet and an IP address (a Network Security Group is optional).
trans-unit.target: For example, Resource Manager will not create the NIC for a virtual machine until it has created the virtual network with a subnet and an IP address (a Network Security Group is optional).

trans-unit.source: A resource group is a logical container that holds related resources for an application, which can consist of multiple virtual machines, NICs, IP addresses, load balancers, subnets, and Network Security Groups.
trans-unit.target: A resource group is a logical container that holds related resources for an application, which can consist of multiple virtual machines, NICs, IP addresses, load balancers, subnets, and Network Security Groups.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can manage all of the resources of the application as a single management unit.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can manage all of the resources of the application as a single management unit.

trans-unit.source: You can create, update, and delete all of them together.
trans-unit.target: You can create, update, and delete all of them together.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example application deployed in a single resource group.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example application deployed in a single resource group.

trans-unit.source: This application consists of:
trans-unit.target: This application consists of:

trans-unit.source: Two virtual machines that use the same storage account, are in the same availability set, and on the same subnet of a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Two virtual machines that use the same storage account, are in the same availability set, and on the same subnet of a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: A single NIC and VM IP address for each virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: A single NIC and VM IP address for each virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: An external load balancer that distributes Internet traffic to the NICs of the two virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: An external load balancer that distributes Internet traffic to the NICs of the two virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: All of these resources of this application are managed through the single resource group that contains them.
trans-unit.target: All of these resources of this application are managed through the single resource group that contains them.

trans-unit.source: You can also see the componentization and dependent relationships between resources when you create a Resource Manager-based virtual machine using Azure PowerShell or the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: You can also see the componentization and dependent relationships between resources when you create a Resource Manager-based virtual machine using Azure PowerShell or the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Before you can run the command that creates the virtual machine, you must create a resource group, a storage account, a virtual network with a subnet, and a NIC with an IP address.
trans-unit.target: Before you can run the command that creates the virtual machine, you must create a resource group, a storage account, a virtual network with a subnet, and a NIC with an IP address.
